member.summary: Empty read only list.
member.typeparam: Contained elements type.

member.name: T:CK.Core.IReadOnlyList`1
member.summary: Represents a read only collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the list.

member.name: M:CK.Core.IReadOnlyList`1.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines the index of a specific item in the list.
member.param: The object to locate in the list.
member.returns: A positive index of the item in this list, if found, a negative index otherwise. If this list is sorted, this must work exactly like : if the item is not found and could be added, the result is a negative number which is the bitwise complement of the index at which the new item should be inserted. To handle the case where the item can NOT be inserted and to be consistent with the positive/negative index semantics, the must be returned. See remarks.

remarks.para: The fact that is used to indicate an "impossible index" enables this covariant list to gracefully handle the case where the item's type is more general that the actual type list.

Similarly, if the implementation is associated to any kind of filters, returning instead of any other negative value indicates to the caller that the item does not appear in the list, but more than that, that it CAN NOT appear.

Note that an implementation can perfectly ignore these guidelines and returns -1 (typically) for any unexisting items: it is not an obligation to challenge any possible filters or constraints inside this IndexOf method.
On the other hand, if this method returns then it MUST mean that the item can NOT appear in this list.

member.name: M:CK.Core.FileUtil.NormalizePathSeparator(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Canonicalizes the path: all '/' and '\' are mapped to (and will also be transformed).
member.param: The path to standardize (can be not be null). It is trimmed and if the path is empty, the empty string is returned.

Ensures that the normalized path will end with a . It should be true for path to directories because we consider that a directory path SHOULD end with the slash as often as possible. When is empty, this is not applied to preserve the fact that the string is empty.

member.name: T:CK.Core.ActionSequence
member.summary: Implementation of . Actions are executed when one of the methods is called and in the order they have been added. An action that is executing can a new action that will be executed later but during the same current call.
member.remarks: This is a low level implementation: no cycle nor call reentrancy detection are made. It is up to the developper to correctly append the actions to the sequence.

member.name: T:CK.Core.ReadOnlyListOnIList`2
member.summary: Adapts a object to the interface where TInner is a T.
member.typeparam: Type of the exposed element.
Type of the list element.
member.remarks:
There is no way to define a beast like ReadOnlyListOnIList<T, TInner> where TInner : T that would extend because of the GetEnumerator support.
The adapter object would have to implement both GetEnumerator() methods (for TInner and T), and even if the constraint states that TInner is T and the IEnumerator is covariant, this is rejected with the following error: cannot implement both 'IEnumerable<T>' and 'System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TInner>' because they may unify for some type parameter substitutions.

member.name: T:CK.Core.ChangeStatus
member.summary: Defines a common change status: it captures the main kind of changes that an object or container can support. This status does not pretend to describe all and every possible changes, it is a trade-off between explicit, simple and well defined terms and the horrifying complexity reality.

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.None
member.summary: No operation occured.

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.Update
member.summary: Denotes the update of an object.

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.Add
member.summary: Denotes a new object (typically the appearing of an item in a collection). It should have been named 'Appear' but 'Add' is a much more common term to refer to object apparition in classical collection scenario.

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.Delete
member.summary: Denotes the suppression of an object (typically the removing of an item from a collection).

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.ContainerClear
member.summary: Denotes the suppression of the content of a container object (typically when destroying a collection): no more content exist.

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.ContainerUpdate
member.summary: Denotes a global change in the content of container object (typically the replacement of items in a collection with items from another one).

member.name: F:CK.Core.ChangeStatus.ContainerDestroy
member.summary: Denotes a global change in the content of container object (typically when clearing a collection): no more values exist.

member.summary: Registers a service associated to a callback (and an optional callback that will be called when the service will be removed). The is called as long as no service has been obtained (serviceInstance returns null). Once the actual service has been obtained, it is kept and serviceInstance is not called anymore.
member.param: Service type to register. It must not already exist in this container otherwise an exception is thrown.
Delegate to call when needed. Can not be null.
Optional action that will be called whenever , or is called and a service as been successfuly obtained.

member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.name: M:CK.Core.ISimpleServiceContainer.Remove(System.Type)
member.summary: Unregisters a service. Can be called even if the service does not exist. The service is first removed and then the OnRemove associated action is called if it exists: this enables OnRemove action to be bound to a method that safely calls back this Remove method.
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.name: M:CK.Core.ISimpleServiceContainer.Clear
member.summary: Unregisters all the services. Any "on remove" actions are executed.

member.name: M:CK.Core.ISimpleServiceContainer.AddDisabled(System.Type)
member.summary: Disables a service: null will always be returned by this regardless of any fallbacks that may exist for this container.
member.remarks: This is not the same as calling with a null instance. A null instance for a service (a callback that always returns null) is nearly the same as calling : any fallbacks (to a base for example) can occur. This is stronger since this must prevent fallbacks.
member.param: Service type to disable. It must not already exist in this container otherwise an exception is thrown.
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.name: T:CK.Core.SimpleServiceContainer
member.summary: Service container (that is a ) subordinated to an optional base IServiceProvider that acts as a fallback if the service is not found at this level. Service creation may be deferred thanks to callback registration and an optional remove callback can be registered with each entry.
member.remarks: This container is registered as the service associated to and thanks to the overridable . This method may be overriden to return other built-in services: these services take precedence over the registered services.

member.summary: Registers a service associated to a callback (and an optional callback that will be called when the service will be removed). The is called as long as no service has been obtained (serviceInstance returns null). Once the actual service has been obtained, it is kept and serviceInstance is not called anymore.
member.param: Service type to register. It must not already exist in this container otherwise an exception is thrown.
Delegate to call when needed. Can not be null.
Optional action that will be called whenever , or is called and a service as been successfuly obtained.
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.summary: Registers a service with its implementation (and an optional callback that will be called when the service will be removed).
member.param: Service type to register. It must not already exist in this container otherwise an exception is thrown.
Implementation of the service. Can not be null.
Optional action that will be called whenever , or .
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.name: M:CK.Core.SimpleServiceContainer.AddDisabled(System.Type)
member.summary: Disables a service: null will always be returned by this regardless of any fallbacks from . Direct services returned by can not be disabled.
member.remarks: This is not the same as calling with a null instance. A null instance for a service (a callback that always returns null) is nearly the same as calling : any fallbacks (to a base for example) can occur. This is stronger since this must prevent fallbacks.
member.param: Service type to disable. It must not already exist in this container otherwise an exception is thrown.
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.

member.name: M:CK.Core.SimpleServiceContainer.Remove(System.Type)
member.summary: Unregisters a service. Can be called even if the service does not exist. The service is first removed and then the OnRemove associated action is called if it exists.
member.returns: This object to enable fluent syntax.
